You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 11. Valāhakavagga
segments.en: 11. Clouds

segments.pli: 104. Udakarahadasutta
segments.en: 104. Lakes

segments.pli: “Cattārome, bhikkhave, udakarahadā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these four lakes.

segments.pli: Katame cattāro?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Uttāno gambhīrobhāso, gambhīro uttānobhāso, uttāno uttānobhāso, gambhīro gambhīrobhāso—
segments.en:
1. One is shallow but appears deep,
  2. one is deep but appears shallow,
  3. one is shallow and appears shallow, and
  4. one is deep and appears deep.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro udakarahadā.
segments.en: These are the four lakes.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cattāro udakarahadūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: In the same way, these four people similar to lakes are found in the world.

segments.pli: Katame cattāro?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Uttāno gambhīrobhāso, gambhīro uttānobhāso, uttāno uttānobhāso, gambhīro gambhīrobhāso.
segments.en:
1. One is shallow but appears deep,
  2. one is deep but appears shallow,
  3. one is shallow and appears shallow, and
  4. one is deep and appears deep.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo uttāno hoti gambhīrobhāso?
segments.en: And how is a person shallow but appears deep?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a person is impressive when going out and coming back, when looking ahead and aside, when bending and extending the limbs, and when bearing the outer robe, bowl and robes.

segments.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: But they don’t really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo uttāno hoti gambhīrobhāso.
segments.en: That’s how a person is shallow but appears deep.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, udakarahado uttāno gambhīrobhāso;
segments.en: That person is like a lake that’s shallow but appears deep, I say.

segments.pli: tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo gambhīro hoti uttānobhāso?
segments.en: And how is a person deep but appears shallow?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa na pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a person is not impressive …

segments.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: But they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo gambhīro hoti uttānobhāso.
Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, udakarahado gambhīro uttānobhāso;
tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo uttāno hoti uttānobhāso?
segments.en: And how is a person shallow and appears shallow?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa na pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a person is not impressive …

segments.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti.
segments.en: Nor do they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo uttāno hoti uttānobhāso.
Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, udakarahado uttāno uttānobhāso;
tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo gambhīro hoti gambhīrobhāso?
segments.en: And how is a person deep and appears deep?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa puggalassa pāsādikaṃ hoti abhikkantaṃ paṭikkantaṃ ālokitaṃ vilokitaṃ samiñjitaṃ pasāritaṃ saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇaṃ.
segments.en: It’s when a person is impressive …

segments.pli: So ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: And they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo gambhīro hoti gambhīrobhāso.
Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, udakarahado gambhīro gambhīrobhāso;
tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro udakarahadūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
segments.en: These four people similar to lakes are found in the world.”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.
